discourse_list.title: Will Dai frozen erc20 address in future?

content.content: I know the issuer of DAI can’t frozen/reclaim DAI token now . But if the US goverment require the core team to modify the source code of makerDAO , to frozen some erc20 address.  Will the core team obey the order ? eg:  I’m an Iranian / Chinese , the US goverment wanna frozen my  DAI .
content.GPT-summary: The post is asking a question about the possibility of the core team of MakerDAO obeying a hypothetical order from the US government to freeze certain ERC20 addresses. The post also indirectly advertises the use of DAI as a cryptocurrency. There is no criticism of the proposal, but rather a question about its potential future actions.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party or author is advertising proposal

content.content: This is the answer you received in the chat, in case you missed it:  LongForWisdom: We can’t modify the DAI ERC20 smart contract, it’s not upgradable and it doesn’t include a blacklist. The closest we could come it to deploy a new version alongside it, but I’m pretty sure that would require us to redeploy the entire Maker protocol (and no one would use a new version that had a DAI token that included a blacklist, imo). The DAI contract: https://etherscan.io/address/0x6b175474e89094c44da98b954eedeac495271d0f#code  I might add that the ‘core team’ (aka, Maker Foundation) has planned to gently disappear over the course of the next years. So eventually there will be on the DAO (aka, MKR holders) controlling the contracts, and I don’t think it will be easy for the US (or anybody else) to force the DAO to do something.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party answering a question about proposal
3rd party giving information about proposal's technical limitations
3rd party discussing the governance structure of the proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
